Key Match Events: Andrew Benintendi homered twice for the third time this season and drove in four runs
Andrew Vaughn had two hits and drove in a pair of runs
Lenyn Sosa went deep for the White Sox as his homer to lead off the third inning extended their lead to 7-1
Jonathan Cannon (4-10) went 6 2/3 innings and picked up his second win in three September starts
Benintendi hit a two-run shot to right field off Angels starter Reid Detmers (4-7)
Zach DeLoach was driven in by Benintendi’s grounder in the second inning
Benintendi hit his team-leading 19th home run in the seventh inning on a solo shot to right-center
Post-Match Reflections: White Sox interim manager Grady Sizemore said, ‘It's been fun to watch. He's on a nice little stretch right now’ about Benintendi
White Sox first baseman Andrew Vaughn said, ‘We’re showing up every day, playing our best baseball and one day at a time. I’m not worried about the future’
Grady Sizemore added, ‘The wins have been hard to come by, so when you can get one, you appreciate it. When you get a couple in a row, it’s even better’
Miscellaneous Highlights: Chicago White Sox took a 3-0 first-inning lead in a matchup of teams with the worst records in the American League
It is only the fourth time the White Sox have won at least three in a row — and the first since June 27-29, when they beat Atlanta and Colorado
Chicago took two of three from Oakland over the weekend to snap a string of 20 consecutive series losses
The White Sox are 36-115 with 11 games left and are trying to avoid the post-1900 record of 120 losses by the 1962 expansion New York Mets
Chicago is 16-57 away from home, well off the post-1900 mark of 65 road losses by the 1935 Boston Braves
